feed.title: Your awesome title
feed.subtitle: Write an awesome description for your new site here. You can edit this line in _config.yml. It will appear in your document head meta (for Google search results) and in your feed.xml site description.

entry.title: Welcome to Jekyll!
entry.content:
:wave: Hi, Ionela !

Welcome to LightFilm Studio. We’re glad you’re here!

I’ve put together this onboarding plan to help you get up to speed in your new role as a on . Feel free to reach out if you have any questions ​

Quick links

  • Technical support

  • Payroll and benefits

  • People directory

:compass: Guiding thoughts

  • Take time to learn. Don’t get sucked into the minutia of decision-making or project involvement too early - there will be plenty of time for that later. In your first 30 days, try to focus on getting comfortable and learning how things work.

  • Invest in relationships. By day 60, you’ll be in execution mode. In your first two months, spend as much time as you can getting to know people and forming relationships.

  • Don’t be afraid to ask. No one expects you to know how things at work right away. Take advantage of that and ask for help when you need it.

:handshake: Meet your team

Who What they can help with
   
   
   

:seedling: Your first week

         
Monday Tuesday Wednesday Thursday Friday
         
         
         

:star2: 90-day milestones

Outcome Steps
   
   
   

:sparkling_heart: Helpful resources

  • Slack channels

  • Internal glossary

  • Asking for help

entry.title: Welcome to Jekyll!
entry.content:
You’ll find this post in your _posts directory. Go ahead and edit it and re-build the site to see your changes. You can rebuild the site in many different ways, but the most common way is to run jekyll serve, which launches a web server and auto-regenerates your site when a file is updated.

Jekyll requires blog post files to be named according to the following format:

YEAR-MONTH-DAY-title.MARKUP

Where YEAR is a four-digit number, MONTH and DAY are both two-digit numbers, and MARKUP is the file extension representing the format used in the file. After that, include the necessary front matter. Take a look at the source for this post to get an idea about how it works.

Jekyll also offers powerful support for code snippets:

Check out the Jekyll docs for more info on how to get the most out of Jekyll. File all bugs/feature requests at Jekyll’s GitHub repo. If you have questions, you can ask them on Jekyll Talk.
entry.summary: You’ll find this post in your _posts directory. Go ahead and edit it and re-build the site to see your changes. You can rebuild the site in many different ways, but the most common way is to run jekyll serve, which launches a web server and auto-regenerates your site when a file is updated.

entry.title: Poc Kiosk Rest Api
entry.content:
PoC Kiosk REST API

  • Any one not specified in here will return 404
APIVERBDescription
admin/config

GET

POST

Retrieve a bundled zip containing both Metascan and Metadefender configurations. Import a bundled MS & MD package, or a (zipped) MD package, or a MD config json
admin/existfileGETcheck whether file exists
admin/licenseGET
admin/license/*POST
admin/mdconfig

GET

POST

Get/Update Kiosk configuration

admin/mgmt/features

GETRetrieve a list of supported Central Mgmt features
admin/prop/*POSTproperties...name the props you want to modify
admin/reload/*GETreload config (specify the config?)
eventsGETGet Event logs from mongDB
filelogs/{startimestamp}/{endtimestamp}GETgenerate & get history of file processed in csv
hash/*GETget the hash value of a specific file
importprofilesPOSTUsed when importing an array of profiles
languageGET
language/*

POST

DELETE

specify the language?
language/namesGET
loginPOSTLogin a user to the WebMC
logoutPOSTLogout a user to the WebMC
profile

GET

POST

GET: Return a profile document with expanded post action

POST: Adds a new profile

profile/id

GET

POST

DELETE

GET: get the profile for the specified ID

POST: update the profile with the specified ID

DELETE: remove the profile with the specified ID

recentsessionsGET
recentsessions/*/*GETspecify the session?
session/*/*/*/*/*GETthis can be used with 5,4,3,2,or 1 parameters
sessionlogs/{starttimestamp}/{endtimestamp}GETgenerate & get history of sessions in csv

stat/filetypes
stat/filetypes/{last X hours}

GETGet the total file types seen in a time range
Default range is 24 hours
stat/sessionshistory
stat/sessionshistory/{last X hours}		GETGet the total file counts from sessions in an hourly time range
Default range is 24 hours
stat/statusGETGet statistics to report to Central Mgmt
userGETGet the list of users on the domain and on the local machine.
usersGETGet the list of local users for WebMC access
users/firstPOSTCreate the first admin user
user/refreshGETrefresh the domain user list (uses WMI)
verbose_debugGETDownload verbose debug log of Kiosk



Attachments

entry.title: Poc Metadefender _ email (v4)
entry.content:
PoC MetaDefender / Email (v4)

About This Guide

This guide is intended to provide the information you need to:

  • Install, configure, and manage MetaDefender Email Gateway Security v4.x.

    MetaDefender Email v3 users

    When using MetaDefender Email v3, refer to MetaDefender Email v3 user guide. In case of migrating from MetaDefender Email v3 to MetaDefender Email Gateway Security v4 see [EMAIL4] 2.5 Migrating from MetaDefender Email v3.
  • Learn about new and updated features, and bug fixes on each MetaDefender Email Gateway Security release (i.e. each product version's release notes).
  • Learn about frequently asked questions and additional concepts through our library of knowledge base articles.

While we offer the option to download this guide to a PDF file, it is optimized for online browser viewing. OPSWAT updates the online version of the guide regularly on an "as needed" basis.  By viewing the document online, you are assured that you are always seeing the most recent and most comprehensive version of the guide.

About MetaDefender Email Gateway Security

Second Layer of Defense for Your Email Security Gateway

Email security gateways, although offering tremendous protection, are not perfect. MetaDefender Email Gateway Security enhances existing email security gateways by offering additional protection with more than 30 anti-malware engines (leveraging both heuristics and signature-based detection) and Deep Content Disarm and Reconstruction (Deep CDR) to combat increasingly popular document-based or image-based attacks. 

Key Features

  • Prevent with email sanitization using Deep Content Disarm and Reconstruction (Deep CDR)
  • Detect and prevent more threats by scanning with more than 30 leading anti-malware engines
  • Prevent potential data breaches using Proactive Data Loss Prevention (Proactive DLP)
  • Leverage heuristic analysis to detect more unknown and targeted attacks
  • Decrease detection time of outbreaks
  • Easily integrate with existing email security layer
  • Real-time monitoring threats 
  • Real-time alert and monitoring
  • Schedule report
  • High performance
  • Quarantine infected and sanitized email

Deployment Options

Mail Proxy Deployment (Generic)

Error rendering macro 'excerpt-include' : No link could be created for '[EMAIL4] 3.8 Mail proxy deployment configuration'.

Cloud Deployment

Error rendering macro 'excerpt-include' : No link could be created for '[EMAIL4] 3.9 Cloud deployment configuration'.

Onsite Microsoft Exchange Deployment

Error rendering macro 'excerpt-include' : No link could be created for '[EMAIL4] 3.10 Onsite Microsoft Exchange deployment'.

MetaDefender Email Gateway Security as mail proxy

MetaDefender does not incorporate or include the following functionalities:

  • Replace email gateway 
    • for spam filtering
    • for NDR based on email validation although we can validate syntactically and mark failed to deliver. 
  • Replace mail server
    • user-based quarantine
    • user authentication based on email address (e.g, active directory) 

Attachments

  • 1360103597_attachments_Presentation Diagrams-05.png
  • 1360103597_attachments_Presentation Diagrams-06.png
  • 1360103597_attachments_Presentation Diagrams-04.png

entry.title: Online Help Poc Home
entry.content:
Online Help PoC Home

Welcome to your new space

Use it to create something wonderful.

To start, you might want to:

  • Customise this overview using the edit icon at the top right of this page.

  • Create a new page by clicking the + in the space sidebar, then go ahead and fill it with plans, ideas, or anything else your heart desires.

Need inspiration?

  • Get a quick intro into what spaces are, and how to best use them at Confluence 101: organize your work in spaces.

  • Check out our guide for ideas on how to set up your space overview.

  • If starting from a blank space is daunting, try using one of the space templates instead.

Attachments
entry.summary: Online Help PoC Home Online Help PoC Home Welcome to your new space Use it to create something wonderful. To start, you might want to: Customise this overview using the edit icon at the top right of this page. Create a new page by clicking the + in the space sidebar, then go ahead and fill it with plans, ideas, or anything else your heart desires. Need inspiration? Get a quick intro into what spaces are, and how to best use them at Confluence 101: organize your work in spaces. Check out our guide for ideas on how to set up your space overview. If starting from a blank space is daunting, try using one of the space templates instead.
